scenario: NextEra Energy reported Q4 2024 earnings, meeting EPS expectations at $0.53 but missing revenue forecasts by 29.4% at $5.385 billion. The company's renewable energy segment, NextEra Energy Resources, added 12 gigawatts to its project backlog and achieved an adjusted earnings increase to $0.22 per share. Florida Power & Light, the regulated utility subsidiary, posted stable earnings and plans significant infrastructure development, including investments in grid hardening and new solar capacities. NextEra Energy faces regulatory challenges and weather-related disruptions but continues its stable dividend policy with 10% annual growth through 2026. The company aims to deliver financial results near the top of its adjusted EPS guidance through 2027, with a target range of $3.45 to $3.70 by 2025.
